title: If we decide to write 'kind regards' as a valediction on an email, do we have to make the 'r' on regards a capital letter or lower case letter? - Quora

response.answer_text: The "r" will be lower case.  Simply follow the example of other complimentary closings like, "Yours truly," "Best wishes," and "Very truly yours."  In modern English usage, all such closings capitalize the first word and end in a comma.

Two additional rules for capitalizing when writing letters.1. Capitalize the first word and all nouns in the salutation (or greeting).    Correct: Dear Sir:My dearest Aunt, Greetings!2. Capitalize the first word in the complimentary closing.    Correct Sincerely,Truly yours,With best wishes, Kind regards
